=Research the topic: {{ $json.body.Topic }}

Additional context: {{ $json.body.Additional_Context }}

I‚Äôm researching **AI Agents and Large Language Models (LLMs)** with the goal of creating high-quality, factual content focused on **practical applications in the workplace**.

Please return only **verifiable, recent information** (from 2024‚Äì2025) and structure the response around these points:

1. Summarize **recent news, trends, or innovations** in the space ‚Äî include **exact dates** and **direct source URLs**.
2. Highlight **concrete business use cases** or deployments ‚Äî focus on **measurable results** and clearly defined workplace benefits.
3. Identify **high-signal discussions** on platforms like Reddit, X, or reputable forums ‚Äî ideally with links to original threads.
4. Include **expert opinions or statements** from industry professionals or research-backed reports ‚Äî ensure sources are cited.

---

üìå **CRUCIAL RULES:**
- Only include **verified facts** with **direct URLs** to sources.
- **No vague claims**, unlinked stats, or general AI hype.
- If data is unavailable or unverifiable, explicitly write: *"No recent verifiable information found."*
- If a source is outdated or lacks context, state the limitation.

---

üéØ **DELIVERABLE:**
Provide a concise list of **exactly 3 key insights**, clearly labeled and sourced. Use bullet points. No filler.

---

üö´ **Do NOT include:**
- Speculative content
- Marketing fluff or overly technical research with no workplace application
- Sections titled ‚ÄúContent Angles‚Äù or ‚ÄúVerified Insights‚Äù ‚Äî just go straight to the findings.

---

üß± **FORMAT Example:**
1. **[Insight Title]**  
   - Summary of the finding  
   - Source: [URL]  
   - Date: [Month YYYY]

2. ‚Ä¶

If nothing meaningful is found for a point, write: *"No recent verifiable information found."*

üß† Perplexity Research ‚Äì Trends & Use Cases

This node queries the Perplexity API to retrieve verified, up-to-date insights on a specific topic ‚Äî ideal for identifying real-world trends, use cases, and expert opinions.

‚úÖ Why Perplexity?
Among available LLMs, Perplexity offers the most source-driven answers, making it the top choice for factual content creation.

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Required

Create a Perplexity API account and set your API key in the credentials.

‚úèÔ∏è How to Personalize

Open the prompt inside the node and:

Change the main topic you want to research (e.g., switch from AI Agents to AI in Healthcare)

Adjust the number of insights (default = 3)

üì® Gmail ‚Äì Select the Best Topic (Human-in-the-loop)

This node sends you an email listing the 3 main topics extracted from the previous Perplexity node. You act as the human-in-the-loop, choosing which topic to use for your content.

‚úÖ Why Gmail?
It's quick, reliable, and always accessible ‚Äî whether you're on your phone or laptop.

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Required

Connect your Gmail account

Set your email address as the recipient

‚úèÔ∏è How to Personalize

Customize the email subject and body to fit your tone or workflow

Decide what information to display (currently: topic titles only)

Optionally, replace Gmail with Telegram or Slack for faster interaction

- Making research the main character ‚Äì Alberto‚Äôs voice should lead

- Fabricating data or quotes

- Frame it around a real thought, reflection, or question Alberto might have  
- Include concrete details or moments from his experience  

**Step 2: Enrich with relevant research**

- Insert them smoothly with phrases like:  
  - ‚ÄúRecent data shows‚Ä¶‚Äù  
  - ‚ÄúInterestingly, this aligns with‚Ä¶‚Äù

parameters.content:
## üöÄ Automate LinkedIn Content Creation with Perplexity, OpenAI & Gmail

What This Workflow Does:
- Generates original, research-based LinkedIn posts
- Combines AI insights with personal storytelling
- Includes human-in-the-loop selection & revision steps
- Automatically creates a conceptual image via DALL¬∑E 3
- Sends the final post and image via email, ready to publish

Perfect For:
- Professionals who want to share high-quality AI-assisted content
- Content creators balancing consistency and authenticity
- Consultants and solopreneurs building a personal brand
- Anyone who wants to turn AI research into personal, sharable stories

## üìã WORKFLOW PROCESS OVERVIEW

Step 1: üîç Perplexity finds 3 recent, verifiable AI-related topics  

Step 2: üìß Email sent ‚Äì you choose your favorite topic  

Step 3: ‚úçÔ∏è OpenAI generates a LinkedIn post draft  

Step 4: üì® You review the post and approve or suggest changes 
 
Step 5: üõ†Ô∏è If needed, AI revises the post based on your feedback  

Step 6: üé® DALL¬∑E creates a conceptual image to match the content  

Step 7: üì¨ Final email sent ‚Äì post text + image ready to copy-paste on LinkedIn

üìù Edit Fields ‚Äì Content Aggregator & Finalizer
This node collects and consolidates the final version of the content before it's published or sent.

While it may look simple, it's strategically important because it:

üí¨ Receives the original content from the OpenAI node

üß† Will also receive updated content from a future node designed to review and refine the post

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Required

No specific setup needed ‚Äî just ensure:

Input from OpenAI is correctly mapped

Future inputs (e.g., from the review process) are connected to overwrite or merge as needed

‚úÖ Gmail ‚Äì Content Review & Approval
This node sends the drafted LinkedIn post to your personal email, allowing a final manual review and approval step.

In the email, you'll find the full content generated by OpenAI.
You‚Äôll be asked: "Do you like the content?"

If your answer is Yes, the workflow proceeds automatically
If No, you can suggest improvements using a form in the next node ‚Äî those suggestions will be used to refine the content

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Required

Connect your Gmail account
Set your personal email as the recipient
Ensure the message content is correctly mapped from the Edit Fields node

‚úèÔ∏è How to Personalize

Customize the subject and message tone to fit your voice
You can modify the approval logic (e.g., based on keywords or reply tracking)
Optionally, add an alternative channel (e.g., Telegram or Slack) for faster interactions

message.content:
**Is 2025 the Year of the Agent?** üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è  
(‚Ä¶e no, non sto cambiando carriera per entrare nei servizi segreti)

Da mesi sentiamo parlare di ‚ÄúAI Agents‚Äù come se fossero l‚Äôultima rivoluzione. E forse, per la prima volta, non √® solo hype.

Negli ultimi anni mi sono occupato di accompagnare team e organizzazioni nel comprendere ‚Äî e applicare ‚Äî l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale nel lavoro quotidiano. Ho visto modelli linguistici diventare assistenti, poi strumenti, e ora‚Ä¶ veri collaboratori autonomi.

‚öôÔ∏è Oggi lavoro con sistemi capaci non solo di rispondere a una richiesta, ma di:
- riconoscere quando una risposta non basta,
- decidere quali strumenti usare,
- verificarne i risultati,
- e portare avanti un flusso di lavoro complesso, senza che nessuno debba tenere il volante.

Li chiamiamo ‚ÄúAI agents‚Äù o ‚ÄúLLM agents‚Äù.
E i risultati? Parlano chiaro.

‚¨áÔ∏è Un esempio concreto:
In un progetto recente, abbiamo implementato un agente capace di accedere ai dati aziendali, analizzarli, generare report e suggerire azioni correttive. Il team? Pi√π focalizzato, pi√π veloce, e con meno tempo speso tra fogli Excel e dashboard.

E non sono l‚Äôunico a notarlo.  
Le ricerche dicono che il 2025 √® il ‚ÄúYear of the Agent‚Äù (Google Trends conferma: mai stato cos√¨ alto l‚Äôinteresse).  
Alcune aziende stanno collegando questi agenti a sistemi RPA, CRM e sistemi BI per automatizzare processi end-to-end. Da chatbot pi√π precisi (grazie al RAG) fino ad agenti che risolvono ticket clienti‚Ä¶ davvero.

Come sottolinea anche Karpathy, questo potrebbe essere solo l‚Äôinizio del ‚Äúdecennio degli agenti‚Äù.
